Rule: Achieving a higher education level (e.g., Doctorate, Masters, Bachelors, Prof-school) significantly increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Being married, as opposed to being divorced, may positively influence the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Working more hours per week (significantly above 40 hours) can increase the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.

While maintaining a Blue-Collar occupation, achieving higher education or working more hours can still lead to higher income. However, transitioning to a Professional occupation might also positively impact income.
